name: Dialogues Poetry Open Mic x Dastak
description: Lovers of poetry and prose — this one is for you!Whether you like listening, reading or performing poems or short stories, be ready to be entertained. We are on a journey to create safe spaces for the writers in town — to share their writing with like-minded people and become part of our community. You can hold us accountable for making you have a good time!Join us at Dialogues Cafe,Koramangala from 7:30 PM onwards, on every 3rd Sunday

organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: Madhuragati: An Odissi Dance Performance
description: Madhuragati - Every step in Odissi resounds with the sweetness of a cultural aesthetic formed over centuries of aspiration for a higher goal.. To celebrate the beauty of this exquisite dance form arising from the life and beliefs of the people of forgone times till now. Anoushka will perform dance works that showcase a range of possibilities highlighting the sculptural and expressive qualities of the Odissi style.The performance features pieces that are seamlessly connected by brief introductory interludes. This carefully crafted format offers an engaging experience for the audience, guiding them through the beauty of the Odissi classical dance form. Originally a sacred ritual dedicated to the gods, Odissi is one of the oldest dance traditions in the world. Odissi speaks of love and union, between the human and divine, transporting viewers to enchanted worlds of magic and spirituality. Its sensuous and lyrical grace reflects both the motifs of Odisha temple sculpture as well as the poetry from the deep wellsprings of Odia music.Anoushka Rahman, disciple of Guru Surupa Sen, is the new soloist and emerging star of The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble.She started her Odissi journey with Smt.Dona Ganguly in Kolkata and holds a Sangeet Bhaskar in Odissi dance and a postgraduate degree in Mathematics.Her association with Nrityagram began in 2018 through a Summer Workshop, which paved the way for advanced training under the guidance of Surupa Sen and Pavithra Reddy. Recognised for her talent and dedication, she was awarded the Virendra Kumar Laroia Fellowship. She has performed with The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble across India, the US, Canada and Sri Lanka and was presented in a solo debut performance in November 2024. At present, Anoushka is a dancer with The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble.ChoreographyGuru Kelucharan Mohapatra (Sun Maiyyā)Surupa SenMusic CompositionPt. Raghunath PanigrahiAshit Desai (Sun Maiyyā)Technical Director & Lighting DesignerLynne FernandezNrityagramwww.nrityagram.orglynne@nrityagram.orgVenue: SABHA Blr, 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042

location.address: 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: IndieWebClub with Ankur and Tanvi
description: What is IndieWebClub?IndieWebClub is part of a growing world-wide network of meetups for everyone who wants to take back their web experience from social media silos, and own their online identities & content, or just want support with blogging!Want to blog more and looking for: ideas, momentum, and a supportive community?Join a gathering of like-minded people and get friendly support with writing, creating, and anything related to using and improving your own website!You do not need to have any tech background or experience in having your own website. You can even start with a Google Doc or your local notes app!You can join the IndieWebClub Bangalore WhatsApp Community by clicking here.AgendaThis will be a tech and design focused session during which we’ll co-work on our personal websites.Please join us even if you don’t have any programming experience! We’ll help you with any technical questions you might have. If possible, we’ll pair you up with a buddy who can walk you through setting up a website or making changes to an existing one.Bring:Your laptop (+ charger)Ideas about what services/features/designs you want your website to haveIf you’re non-technical, come with questions and we’ll try to find you answersAs usual, we will end the meetup with a prompt and a writing session.

description: For hard-core Potterheads age 12 and above!Get into the minds of the characters, ferret out the intricacies of the plot - enter the wizarding world and share your thoughts and insights!Will help if you have read all the Harry Potter books - this discussion will be based only on the books and not the movies.The event is curated by Lahe Lahe Caravan and is being hosted at Atta Galatta.

name: Qu for Quiz
description: The Qu for Quiz is based on a grid format with the grids formed by topics on one axis and level of difficulty (and hence the points) on the other. The topics could be varied like History, Sports, Music, Literature, Movies and more. A team of two members would get to choose a topic and the level of difficulty and the question would be revealed. The rest of the teams can go for the buzzer if they know the answer. Depending on the number of teams registering, the size of the grid would be decided.Ganesh Balakrishnan is an entrepreneur, marketer and creator of terrible dad jokes. His claim to fame is attempting to sell shoes during the pandemic, culminating in a viral Shark Tank "Down But Not Out" appearance. He is a collector of useless facts since childhood, and has dabbled in trivia quiz circuits since college. ganesh.flatheads@gmail.comKarthik Srinivasan is a pseudo-retired software leader by choice, specializing in innovative ideas to spend time that include organizing cricket leagues at the scale of IPL but for free, staying up to date on latest debates in virtual social groups helmed by family and friends and more on similar lines. emailkarth@gmail.com

name: Love in the Time of Algorithms by The Self Centre
description: Experience an intimate theatrical journey through modern romance with five compelling vignettes. From awkward first dates to long-term relationship crossroads, witness authentic moments of connection, heartbreak, hope, and discovery. These slice-of-life stories capture the beautiful complexity of dating and relationships in contemporary life.Who is The Self Centre?Self Centre is a space dedicated to exploring the self and dilemmas of our times through theatre. We create and curate work that responds to the pulse of the community, offering space for reflection, dialogue, and transformation. Our approach—what we call transformational theatre—is rooted in the belief that performance can shift not only perspectives, but also possibilities for how we live and relate to one another.You can follow them on Instagram at @selfcentre.in

name: Food In Literature Book Club
description: Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well. So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us for a dialogue on “Food in Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we read our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.December Read: The Evin Prison Bakers' Club by Sepideh QolianWe assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available. Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who love to read and eat!When: Saturday, 20th December, 2025 at 11 a.m.Where: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indira NagarAges: 18+Registration is mandatory (link in bio)Copies of the book are available at the store.

name: AG Lit Sisters
description: The AG Lit Sisters are closing the year with a beautifully cozy December gathering: Snowflakes & Storytelling!Think twinkling lights, favourite winter reads, shared laughter, and the joy of being surrounded by bookish soul-sisters. 💙📚📅 December 20, 2025⏰ 1:30–3:00 PM📍 Atta Galatta, Indiranagar☕ Coffee on the house for everyone!Entry is FREE but online registration is mandatory, and we have only 20 slots. First come, first seated!Bring your favourite winter story, your festive cheer, and your warmest energy. Let’s make it a December to remember. 🌨️✨❓ Question of the Day:Which book gave you the coziest winter feeling this year?

description: In a world where the old stories of domination over nature no longer hold, we stand at a crossroads: regeneration or collapse. What will be (y)our legacy?The legacy we leave behind will be shaped by the strength of our community.Join us for the opening weekend of the All Living Things Environmental Film Festival’s 6th edition as we take over Bangalore International Centre in Bengaluru. It’s a weekend-long celebration packed with stellar cinema, immersive art experiences, workshops, filmmaker Q&A, and delicious food and drinks included in your ticket price! name: Coffee and Conversations
description: What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.Be a part of the Listener`s circle Coffee & Conversations - Edition 5.Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: Slow Sunday by the Eleven AM Club
description: The last Slow Sunday of the year is here!One of my personal highlights this year has been gamifying my goals and making them genuinely fun. For instance, I made a No Food Delivery Days punch card and didn’t order in for an entire month (!). I made another for hitting my book goals. I even created a bingo card of things I wanted to try — hosting 10 Slow Sundays was one of them.This Sunday, I’d love for us to slow down together and reflect on the beautiful year gone by — and maybe dream up little things you want to try in the next one. Big goals, tiny experiments, or just gentle intentions. For example, one of my 2026 goals is to reduce my dependence on e-comm apps. Yours could be anything at all.I’ll have everything ready: paper, glue, prompts, and lots of space to think, write, doodle, plan, or play.As always, the theme is only a nudge — you’re welcome to bring your activity bag stuffed with whatever you feel like working on.Hope to see you, lovelies, for the last Slow Sunday of this beautiful yearWhat is the Eleven AM Club? A space for slow, intentional gatherings where time stretches, stories unfold, and creativity finds room to breathe. At Eleven AM Club, we come together to write, draw, cook, read, play, or simply be—no rush, no agenda, just a day well spent.

name: Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle: Book Launch
description: In an era where Gen Zs and millennials seek meaning through experiences rather than possessions, Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle – Stories of Friendships & Adventures in Nature offers exactly the kind of soulful escape today’s young adventurers crave. For those who live for spontaneous road trips, mountain treks, beach escapades, and serendipitous conversations with strangers—and secretly nurture the hope of finding love and companionship along the way—Priyanka Kumar’s latest collection is a deeply relatable read. With its mix of short stories and memoir-style reflections, this book resonates with those who believe that real connection and personal discovery often happen far away from the familiar.The newest installment in Priyanka’s celebrated People’s Kafe series, Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle brings together heartfelt stories and travel-infused memories that capture the healing magic of nature and the unspoken bonds we form with people and places. Though it’s not a travelogue in the conventional sense, the book reads like one—with vivid glimpses into landscapes and emotions that stay with the reader long after they turn the final page.And yet, the book is as much about the people as it is about the places. There are tales of peacocks who roamed her childhood garden like kin, strangers-turned-friends on spontaneous journeys, and even encounters that subtly hint at love blossoming when least expected. The presence of love—gentle, unforced, and organic—is a quiet undercurrent in a couple of these stories, offering a warm, relatable thread for every romantic dreamer who has ever looked out of a train window and wondered, what if?

name: Nagarathpete darshan heritage walk.
description: On this fourth walk of our's in Kempe Gowda's "Pettah" area we take the guests on a darshan of one of the most popular temples in Bangalore which is also associated with the popular Karaga festival.Join us as we take a walk along the narrow meandering lanes of the Pettah to know about it's history as well as discover monuments hidden behind modern buildings.As we take you through the lanes we stop at the factory where the famous Mysore rockets were made & how they influenced the US national anthem. We also stop at a place connected to India's freedom struggle. After that we pay a quick visit to the silk weavers in the neighborhood.If we still have time we might also pay our respects at the tombs of a few Sufi warriors who were martyred during the III Anglo-Mysore war in 1791.Last but not the least we have breakfast at a legendary food spot.

description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no one taking selfies, and no one around you scrolling. Come unwind, reset, and feel the warmth of a slow December Sunday.The event will be fluid - you can dip into activities if you want, or chat with new people or graze at our high tea counter! Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones). We will not be using social media on our phones at the event; we will only take photos with a camera. Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! Strictly no devices (no laptops, iPads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag.  E-books are allowed.**Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter. Do not purchase a ticket if you are unwilling to surrender your devices for 3 hours!

name: Around the World in 8 Ragas
description: Across continents and centuries, humanity has carried one universal companion: Music. From desert caravans tracing ancient trade routes, to sailors navigating uncharted seas, to pilgrims and warriors moving across borders, cultures have exchanged not only goods and beliefs—but also sound. “Around the world in 8 Ragas” is a concert that explores how musical scales, though born in different corners of the globe, reveal a shared human instinct for expression.Follow the journeys of iconic scales—Pentatonic, Raga, Maqam, Modes, and more. We uncover how these musical structures spread through Silk Road markets, African diaspora rhythms, medieval monasteries, and colonial crossroads. We invite audiences to listen to history, one Raga at a time.Performers :Ashwin Baliga, Vocals (US-Based Indian Classical vocalist, student of Mahesh Kale and Pt. Milind Chittal, creator of the world's first Raga Bath)Shadaj Godkhindi, Flute (Acclaimed flutist and student of renowned maestro Pt. Pravin Godkhindi)Amit Kavthekar, Tabla (Multi-Genre collaborator and prodigious disciple of Ustad Allah Rakha and Ustad Zakir Hussain)Vivek Santosh, Keys (Trinity-trained Classical pianist with a Masters in Carnatic Music)

name: The Store Of Life: Book Reading Session by Shruthi
description: At the supermarket, you fill your basket to get the most for your money. At the Store of Life, you fill your basket to get the most out of your time, the one truly finite resource.At this book-reading session, we’ll explore a few chapters together, try out some simple activities, and reflect on what we choose to carry with us. As you spend your most important currency, your time, with me, I hope to fill your life basket with a little bit of joy, clarity, and purpose.This event is free of charge, but it is “charged” in that precious currency of time.Whether you're struggling to say no, trying to find balance, hoping to create space for what matters, or curious about the compounding power of small habits, there’s something here for you.Told through simple doodles and gentle reflections, the book invites you to pause, pick wisely, and carry only what brings joy, peace, and purpose. You can flip through it lightly, dip into it occasionally, or explore it deeply - whatever your heart desires.So… what will you choose to carry with you?And if you can, do join the session. It would fill my basket with joy.

name: Mahabharat Quest: Mythological Walks at Lalbagh
description: ✨ What if the Mahabharat came alive through the trees, rocks, & lake of Lalbagh?We wanted to bring the new away to help you experience the Epic that shapes much of India’s cultural imagination.We’ll explore stories and symbols from the saga linked to specific trees, rocks, lakes, and sculptures in the Garden — tracing how they appear across Vyas’ Critical Edition, Ganguli’s translation, Sarala’s Mahabharat, Pampa’s Bhil Bharata, Puranic lore, and later retellings.Whether you’ve joined our flagship walks (🔴 North, 🟢 West, 🔵 Main Gate) or themed walks like 🟣 Ramayan Quest — OR this will be your first time at the Garden (or with the Epic) — there’s something both familiar and new for everyone in this never-done-before 🟠 Mahabharat Quest.What is guaranteed is your relationship with the saga, and the space will change forever!🏙️ Afternoon Walk — 06 Dec (Sat) ⏰ 3–4:30 PM (1.5 hours)🌅 Morning Walk — 07 Dec (Sun) ⏰ 7:30–9 AM (1.5 hours)👣 Slow-paced along a shaded path (~1.5 km) for all (10+ years and above), with plenty of resting spots for immersive storytelling.📝 Limited slots with time-based offers, so book early!ABOUT THE PROJECT:Before & Beyond History is an initiative under Mythematical, Prihistorica & Cosmonomic — curated and hosted by Anupriy Kanti & Rohina Thapar — that offers in-person experiences blending mythology, prehistory, and astronomy.

This fun, beginner-friendly workshop is all about discovering the magic of oil pastels while creating your very own floral masterpiece.We’ll start by exploring the basics of oil pastel application — blending, layering, and adding texture. Then you’ll learn to draw and colour a range of charming flowers like carnations, lavender, foxtail, and more.Once you’re comfortable with the techniques, you’ll put it all together by composing your own floral artwork — a cute pot arrangement, a dreamy bouquet, or a background full of colourful blooms. description: I am honoured to invite you to the launch of my debut novel at Atta Galatta, Koramangala.ETC. is a romantic whodunit that spans continents — a story of love fractured by fate, secrets buried in silence, and a journey that crosses Russia, Ukraine, and India in search of the truth.At its heart is Aditya… a man who risks everything to uncover what happened the night his wife vanished in the Russian wilderness — and why.This evening will unravel:• the origin of the story• readings from key passages• a deep dive into the characters• an open Q&A• followed by book signingEvent Details:📅 19th December⏰ 6:30 PM onwards📍 Atta Galatta, KoramangalaJoin me as we step into a world of secrets, longing, betrayal, and discovery — where not everything is as it seems… and every answer leads to another question.All are welcome.

name: Earthlore: The Indigenous Music Band
description: Earthlore Band is a one-of-a-kind musical collective from India that blends indigenous heritage with contemporary soundscapes. Rooted in the traditions of communities such as the Jenu Kuruba and Paniya tribes of Karnataka and Kerala, the band features tribal artists who completed an intensive nine-month fellowship program with professional mentorship, supported by the Tata Trusts.Their music is a powerful expression of ancestral stories, rituals, and a timeless bond with nature — an authentic cultural experience brought to the stage.After a captivating performance in Kochi, Earthlore Band now arrives in Bengaluru.Come experience the magic of tribal music in your city!

name: In Her Interest by Zerodha (Single and Secure)
description: Women have a complicated relationship with money.And it starts early.Many families shield their daughters from anything related to ‘finance’. This well-meaning protection ends up being a disservice. When these young women step into the real world, they lack the confidence to make financial decisions - not because they’re incapable, but because they were never given information on budgeting, savings and investments.Later in life, many continue to rely on their partners for investment decisions. This dependency on others will only stop when they have the right information and toolkit to take back control.That’s where we come in.Our upcoming session is a safe, private space - where no question is too small or too basic. Really. Come as you are, with your curiosity.We’ll be focusing on one core idea:Building financial security for women.The session at Bangalore will be led by two amazing experts who truly get it.Our speakersSatya SontanamAishwarya NatrajTo give the session structure, we're dividing it up into 3 themes.This is an anonymous Google form https://forms.gle/4or3s4fHtrijigmx6. Please send in your questions. The speakers will address all the questions during the session.Money FoundationsPersonal FinanceSafety NetsHealth & InsuranceInvesting & Wealth-BuildingCareer, Choices & Life StagesWorkSaving taxes on salaryManaging DebtWomen on a BreakEntrepreneurship & Side IncomeHousing & Big PurchasesTransitions & Long-Term PlanningFertilityRelationships & MoneySingle MothersDivorceRetirementLegacyElder careSession goals:Simplify money conceptsBust common financial mythsBuild your confidence in making financial decisionsNo jargon, just real talk.Note: This is the Basics of Finance - we are not talking stocks and shares - so please sign up only if you want to know more about taxes.Once you buy your ticket, you also have the option of sending in your question in advance, the speakers address all these questions through the session - so send them in :)

name: Mohlat
description: Event Name: Mohlat: Zamaane ke fasaane seTheme: Poetry, Storytelling & Unfiltered ConversationsIn a city that runs on deadlines, traffic, and endless scrolling, when was the last time you truly paused?Mohlat (meaning 'respite' or 'grace period') is not just an event; it is a sanctuary carved out of time. We invite you to "Zamaane ke fasaane se"—an intimate evening dedicated to the art of slowing down.This is a space where the noise of the world fades away, replaced by the rhythm of poetry and the warmth of stories. Whether you are a Shayar with a diary full of couplets, a storyteller with a memory to share, or a listener looking for sukoon (peace), you belong here.WHAT TO EXPECT ✨ The Mehfil Vibe: Forget cold auditoriums. Imagine warm lights, floor seating (cushions and rugs), and a circle of strangers who feel like old friends.🎙️ The Open Mic: The stage is open to everyone. Hindi, Urdu, English, or Hinglish—language is no barrier when the emotion is real. Share your Nazms, Ghazals, or free-verse stories.☕ Chai & Guftagu: What is a poetry session without tea? Enjoy light refreshments and engage in meaningful conversations during our breaks.WHO IS THIS FOR?The Writer who has been hiding their poetry in the Notes app.The Listener who finds comfort in the words of others.The Soul looking to disconnect from screens and reconnect with people.NOTE: This is a zero-judgment zone. You don't need to be a professional performer. You just need to be authentic.

name: In Our Power: A Postpartum Sharing Circle
description: In our knowing. In our becoming. IN OUR POWER. A Postpartum Sharing CircleBecoming a mother is one of the most profound and transformative experiences of a woman's life. So why does it so often show up as loneliness, confusion, doubt, shame, and guilt?Join us for 1.5 hours of honest exploration. We'll examine the systems that shaped our postpartum experience and reclaim the transformation that was always ours.Facilitated by Natasha Uppal, India's first matrescence coach and Sanjana Prasad, a trauma-informed psychologist - experts who believe your story matters and that healing happens in community.Whether postpartum was 6 months or 10 years ago, if you're ready to share, listen, and normalise the full spectrum of the motherhood experience, join us.

name: Manasa's Mat Pilates + High Tea
description: Manasa is back! Visiting her hometown of Bangalore from Chicago, we’re thrilled to welcome her to the Studio as she brings her signature high-tempo, form-focused Pilates style to the mat.Pilates with Manasa is a comprehensive movement therapy for the entire body. It meets your body exactly where it is, celebrating all its imperfections while working on posture, spinal health, controlled breathing, and deep muscles that often go unnoticed. It’s strength, mobility, and flexibility all rolled into one.After class, we’ll settle down for a nourishing High Tea, a cozy way to recharge, connect, and savor the moment. Come join us for a rejuvenating session of pilates, wholesome bites, and perhaps meaningful connections.About ManasaManasa is a powerhouse instructor who inspires self-love through every sweat session. She thrives on seeing her clients challenged—and humbled—by the effectiveness of low-impact, mindful workouts. name: Animal Flow + Contemporary Dance with Ronita
description: Flow & Form is a dynamic movement experience that blends the strength and resilience of Animal Flow with the expressiveness and freedom of Contemporary Dance. Basics of both forms will be taught and then woven together into a unique sequence to get a flavour of mixed physical practice. So be ready to be challenged physically and end with a fun exploration of dance! Animal Flow is a Quadrupedal Movement Training system that is designed to improve the performance, resilience, and function of the “human animal”. It offers a versatile and adaptable movement practice that can be an integrated approach into other fitness programs and training. Contemporary Dance Practice is an umbrella movement practice that incorporates evolving and diverse approaches to dance, weaving various styles and forms, traditional and urban, with a focus on movement philosophies. It allows the freedom of expression and to break away from structure or to emerge out of it. It is characterized by fluidity, expressiveness, and innovation, training the mind-body connections uniquely, and the physical-mental capacity is heightened.

name: Kyun Nahi? - Live at the record store
description: Kyun Nahi? is an evening shaped around the idea of melody in language, how words carry rhythm, how poetry becomes song, and how emotion moves between the two. Curated by percussionist and composer Viveick Rajagopalan, this special trio performance brings together guitarist Abhay Nayampalli and harmonium player Satyajeet Sanju for a set built exclusively for Ram’s Musique Experience.Across the hour, the trio will explore original compositions, spoken fragments, and reimagined pieces from poetic traditions, letting melody, cadence, and improvisation lead the way. Viveick’s percussive vocabulary, which moves between classical, folk, and contemporary forms, creates the foundation; Abhay’s fluid, exploratory guitar work adds harmony and texture; and Satyajeet’s harmonium brings warmth, breath, and lyrical resonance to the soundscape.The result is not a concert in the traditional sense, but a conversation between rhythm and language, between poetry and melody, between three musicians who listen deeply to one another.Viveick Rajagopalan — percussionist, composer, and collaborator known for blending classical Indian rhythms with contemporary forms. His work spans folk traditions, global percussion, and innovative cross-genre projects.Abhay Nayampalli — a versatile guitarist whose sound moves fluidly between jazz, Indian classical influences, and ambient textures. His playing is marked by nuance, clarity, and melodic intuition.Satyajeet Sanju — harmonium player, vocalist, and composer rooted in Hindustani traditions, known for his warm tonality and sensitive approach to phrasing and improvisation.Curated by Viveick, the trio creates an interplay of rhythm, harmony, and poetry that forms the heart of Kyun Nahi.Join us on Sunday, December 7th, 2025 at 7:00PM for a performance that lingers in the spaces between music and meaning.

name: PoV (Lecture 21): Extra-Dimensional Explorations
description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where classroom-styled lectures meet craft cocktails in pubs and bars.In our 21st lecture, we're bringing K. Sridhar, a Particle Physicist, to talk to us about a question that sounds straight out of science fiction, but sits firmly at the cutting edge of modern physics: do we really live in a world with only three spatial dimensions OR are there more hiding in plain sight? Do we live in a world with three spatial dimensions or more? Why would we even want more than three dimensions? If there are more dimensions, why do we not see them? If these dimensions are too small to be seen, can we still find ways to discover their effects in experiments? Why have we not seen them in experiments thus far?Why would physicists even imagine a universe with extra dimensions? If such dimensions exist, why don’t we see them when we look around? Could they be folded up so tightly that they escape everyday perception—and if so, can their presence still be detected through subtle experimental signatures? And perhaps the most intriguing question of all: if these ideas are so compelling, why haven’t experiments revealed them yet?This lecture will take us through the logic, curiosity, and careful scepticism with which physicists grapple with these questions, offering us a glimpse into how far theoretical imagination can stretch, and where experimental reality pushes back. Expect an evening that opens up the universe, shrinks it down again, and leaves us with more wonder than certainty. Also expect to be reaching for multiple pints of Geist beer by the end—because some questions, once asked, demand both thought and refreshment.What to Expect:A 45-minute lecture probing the possibility of hidden dimensions and what it would mean to discover they exist15 minutes of interactive Q&A to dive deeper into the possibilities of these explorationsOne Geist beer on tap + a complimentary appetiser or a mocktail included with your ticketA lively mixer where you can connect with curious minds and share your own perspectives on string theoryEvent Details:📅 Wednesday, 10 December | 7 pm to 9 pm📍 Fandom at Gilly's Redefined, Koramangala💰 Early bird pricing available for the first 10 ticketsAbout the LecturerK. Sridhar is a particle physicist and novelist who has lived and worked across Bombay and Bangalore. He was previously at the Tata Institute of Fundamental Research before moving to the Azim Premji University. He has published close to 150 research papers in physics, along with the book Brane Worlds and Extra Dimensions in the Cambridge Mathematical Monographs Series, and an edited volume titled Breaking the Silo: Integrated Science Education in India. Alongside physics, he is a regular writer on philosophy and the visual arts. His first novel, Twice Written, was published in 2011, followed by a critical edition in 2019, and his second novel, Ajita, was published in January 2025 by Westland Books.About Pint of ViewInspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the US, Pint of View brings this format to India for the first time. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand, walking out with a new way of seeing the world.Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

name: Italian Fresh Pasta & Tiramisu Workshop
description: Date night/ family night: Come with a friend, partner or your kid and bond the Italian way. Or come solo and get paired with a new friend!Chef Natasha Celmi, who is trained and lived in Italy with her Southern Italian husband, is now in Bangalore at Canella Studio.Transport yourself to beautiful Italy in a cosy ambience of Italian music and food that is straight from an Italian home- fresh, flavourful and hits the spot! Upgrade your everyday with a masterclass in making fresh pasta dough. You’ll roll, shape and cook it to perfection, then knock up a delicious sauce for an undeniably satisfying bowlful. Aprons on!The menu is fresh hand rolled gnocchi (mini pasta pillows with a potato and flour dough) in the Chef's signature Italian pomodoro or pesto sauce and the most decadent grandma's secret tiramisu.What will you do:Make your own gnocchi dough from scratch, roll and shape the gnocchi and cook them. Demo by the chef of the two sauces- Italian tomato and pesto which you use later to toss your gnocchi in. Recipes will be shared for everything.Get to work making and layering your own mini tiramisu which you can take home to share with others...or enjoy it over dinner with your cooking mate.Sit down at the beautiful dinner tables at the studio to enjoy your pasta dinner while chatting with other guests and making new friends, or just bond with your date partner!Suitable for beginners and advance cooks- open to all!

description: _Do You Think You Know the City?_Step onto our unique floor projector for an immersive and competitive trivia experience that puts your Bengaluru knowledge to the test—its streets, stories, people, quirks, and hidden histories. And everyone who plays doesn’t leave empty-handed — all participants receive goodies as a thank-you for bringing their Bengaluru spirit to the game.

name: The Winter Waltz
description: Step into The Winter Waltz, a beautifully curated masquerade evening unlike anything Bengaluru has experienced before. A night shaped by winter hues, hidden faces, warm candlelight, and the intimate rhythm of the waltz.This is not a party — it’s a ballroom night crafted for those who appreciate elegance, intention and meaningful connection. Expect a room full of rare, interesting people, each arriving behind a mask, each ready to meet the evening with curiosity.What makes it special:The last edition sparked a quiet cultural shift in the city — a return to old-world charm, intentional gatherings and experiences built around people, not crowds. The Winter Waltz continues that story, bringing together those who dare to show up with elegance, warmth and a touch of mystery.Limited seats. Invite only.Dress code: Evening bling attire. Refined, elegant, winter-toned. Tuxes, suits, corsets and gowns gala is the least we expect.

name: Lecture 22: Fantastic Trees & Where We Find Them
description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where lectures meet drinks in a relaxed pub-style setting.We live in a city of gardens, rain trees, jacarandas, tabebuias, boulevards that purple in March and yellow in September, and lakes that may or may not actually be lakes anymore. A city where the seasons don’t just change, they bring in a colourful change. One month the streets are carpeted with pink trumpet petals, another month it feels like the entire city is exhaling gulmohars.We even start associating our favourite city spots with trees as icons. Like the giant Peepal tree that becomes the background for every Cubbon Reads pictures, or the beloved bookstore Champaca that almost seems suspended amongst the trees, or the boulevard when we go through on Old Airport Road.Which is why this edition of Pint of View is called Fantastic Trees and Where We Find Them. It is not going to be just a lecture for botany enthusiasts. It’s going to be your unofficial guide to recognising the giants we walk past every day.Ecologist Akshay Surendra will take you deep into the secret life of trees: how they are born, how they grow, how they have sex (yes, trees), how they die, and why some insist on growing everywhere while others play hard to get.Part storytelling, part pub quiz, part ode to Bangalore’s green soul, you’ll leave this session with a sharper eye, a calmer mind, and a sensory appreciation for the trees that have been quietly holding this city together long before we arrived. All this, over a complimentary Geist beer or mocktail at the gorgeous Jamming Goat 3.0 in Indiranagar.🧠 What to Expect💭 A 45-minute talk that will introduce you to the fascinating lives of trees: how trees are born, how they grow, how they have sex, and how they die💬 15–20 minutes of Q&A to question, debate, and discuss🍹 A 30-minute mixer to connect with fellow curious minds🍺 One complimentary Geist beer or mocktail with your ticket🥨 À la carte food available throughout the evening✨ Conversations and one-on-one with the speaker post-talk📅 Event DetailsSunday, 14th December 2025 | 4 PM – 6 PM📍 Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar, Bangalore🎫 Limited to 90 attendees | Super early bird pricing for the first 10 tickets👤 About the SpeakerAkshay Surendra is an ecologist interested in how wild plants (and sometimes animals) interact with each other, and what those interactions mean for big questions around diversity, conservation and management of forests. He's had the good fortune to study trees and live amongst them in the rainforests of Sri Lanka, Andaman Islands and the Western Ghats. Akshay is currently a visiting faculty, Environmental Studies, at Ashoka University and holds a Ph.D. from Yale University.🍻 About Pint of ViewPint of View is inspired by the Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., and we’re bringing this format to India across major cities. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables and you leave with a drink in hand and a new way of seeing the world.Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻
